sailpoint.api
Class PolicyUtil.ApplicationSummary

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.api.PolicyUtil.ApplicationSummary
Enclosing class:
PolicyUtil
public static class PolicyUtil.ApplicationSummary
extends java.lang.Object

Model for entitlements on a specific application account. While the attribute/permission models are similar, it is nice to render them in slightly different ways so keep them on different lists.

Field Summary

          The ItemSummary objects for the attributes.

Field Detail

name

public java.lang.String name
The name of the application.

attributes

public java.util.List<PolicyUtil.ItemSummary> attributes
The ItemSummary objects for the attributes. Manipulate this list using PolicyUtil.ApplicationSummary.assimilate(boolean, String, Object).

permissions

public java.util.List<PolicyUtil.ItemSummary> permissions
The ItemSummary objects for the permissions. Manipulate this list using PolicyUtil.ApplicationSummary.assimilate(boolean, String, Object).

Constructor Detail

PolicyUtil.ApplicationSummary

public PolicyUtil.ApplicationSummary()
Method Detail

assimilate

public void assimilate(boolean permission,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.Object value)
Assimilate the given permission target/right or attribute value into this ApplicationSummary. Items are collapsed for the same name/target.

Parameters:
permission - True if the item is a permission.
name - The name of the attribute or target of the permission.
value - The attribute value or permission right.

assimilate

public void assimilate(java.util.List<PolicyUtil.ItemSummary> items,
                       boolean permission,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.Object value)
Add an item to a list collapsing by name if possible. Also filter duplicate values.

Parameters:
items - The list to add the item to.
permission - True if the item is a permission.
name - The name of the attribute or target of the permission.
value - The attribute value or permission right.

getItem

public PolicyUtil.ItemSummary getItem(java.util.List<PolicyUtil.ItemSummary> items,
                                      java.lang.String name)
Look for an item on a list.
